Html:
Hi,

I am currently trying to explore interaction of 3D AR objects with human beings. As an example, I have a project which overlays a mp3 player on a marker. The mp3 player has a Start button, Pause Button and Stop button. The code is designed to play music on the click of a mouse button on the start button, puse the music on the cick of pause button, etc. I wonder if the same can be achieved through human interaction instead of mouse. For example, can I play the music by "touching" the start button with my hand. It would require some kind of motion detection. Does anybody have any idea whether such a thing can be achieved?

Regards,

Anshu Dutta

i have similar idea like you, i want to creating a virtual game controller, my idea is using several markers that represent buttons, if a marker blocked by a finger (mean you push the marker) that button is pressed
Having the same request and don't know how to handle this? azer89's idea is one of the option but still limited! Any help would be welcome!
